CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper May 28, 1955, pg. 6, reads: "Deranged Man Fires Home - Above is what is left of the home (now boarded up) of the Allende family of Kilbuck Road, near Sewickley, after the husband and father, Pedro, went berserk last Wednesday and fired it and a shack in the back yard. The interior was gutted by the blaze and the shack was level to the ground. Mrs. Allende was released Thursday from the Sewickley Valley Hospital, where she had been confined because of shock. She and the couple's four children will got to New York to make their home with relatives. Mr. Allende was taken to Woodville. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Burned two and one half story clapboard house with boards nailed in front of doors, after fire started by Pedro Allende, Kilbuck Street near Sewickley
